item.title: GIA in the EIOA class: exploring the impact of Brexit (2)
item.description: The Brexit topic from the BBC News. (The Brexit topic link/Group drive)

item.title: GIA in the EIOA class: exploring the impact of Brexit (1)
item.description: UK companies can and should see the current high-uncertainty environment as a spur to rethink their supply chain strategies and make them more resilient.

item.title: Linking Global Crop and Livestock Consumption to Local Production Hotspots
item.description: Identifying production hotspots for global crop and livestock consumption by a Spatially Explicit Multi-Reginal Input-Output model ( Zhongxiao’s work on Global Food Security).

item.title: Assessing the spatially explicit global footprints of European net-zero strategies
item.description: “Someone’s sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago” —Warren Buffett.

item.title: Impacts of COVID-19 and fiscal stimuli on global emissions and the Paris Agreement
item.description: Published:22 December 2020 Authors: Yuli Shan, Jiamin Ou, Daoping Wang, Zhao Zeng, Shaohui Zhang, Dabo Guan & Klaus Hubacek https://www.

item.title: RP Project
item.description: Measuring in Arc-Seconds The source link USGS: United States Geological Survey.

item.title: Global Scenarios of Resource and Emissions Savings from systemic Material Efficiency in Buildings and Cars
item.description: Abstract Here we present a high-resolution approach for tracking material flows and energy use of products throughout their life cycles, focusing on passenger vehicles and residential buildings.

item.title: EIOA Class: Integrated Group Assignment(IGA)
item.description: Each group is expected to perform a research question about two real-world issues: BREXIT and national stimulus plans. in a post COVID-19 world.
